vote.title: To authorize the Director of the Department of Public Service to execute those documents necessary for the City to grant encroachments to OhioHealth Corporation to legally allow foundation, monument signs, and wall to extend into the public rights-of-way located at 277 E. State Street. ($0.00)
vote.description:
Explanation
1. Background
To authorize the Director of the Department of Public Service to execute those documents necessary for the City to grant encroachment easements to OhioHealth Corporation to allow foundation, monument signs, and wall to extend into the public right-of-way.
 
The City of Columbus, Department of Public Service, received a request from OhioHealth Corporation, owner of the site, asking that the City allow foundation, monument signs, and wall to extend into the public right-of-way. The items will extend into E. Chapel Street, E. Town Street, and E. State Street. This project is located around property located at 277 E. State Street Parcel 010-051443. This project is a new building for Grant Trauma and Critical Care Center on the south side of East State Street that will be replacing the existing building. These encroachments are located within the easements as described below and within the attached exhibits. The following legislation authorizes the Director of the Department of Public Service to execute those documents necessary for the City to grant these encroachments to legally allow them to extend into the public rights-of-way. Allowing these elements to extend into the public right-of-way will allow the building proficiently and safely operate as a Trauma and Critical Care Center. A value of $500.00 for the encroachment easements was established.
 
2. Fiscal Impact
The City will receive a total of $500.00, to be deposited in Fund 7748, Project P537650, for granting the requested encroachments.
 
 
Title
To authorize the Director of the Department of Public Service to execute those documents necessary for the City to grant encroachments to OhioHealth Corporation to legally allow foundation, monument signs, and wall to extend into the public rights-of-way located at 277 E. State Street. ($0.00)
 
 
Body
WHEREAS, the City of Columbus, Department of Public Service, received a request from OhioHealth Corporation, owner of the site, asking that the City allow foundation, monument signs, and wall to extend into the public right-of-way. The items will extend into E. Chapel Street, E. Town Street, and E. State Street; and
 
WHEREAS, this project is a new building for Grant Trauma and Critical Care Center on the south side of East State Street that will be replacing the existing building. These encroachments are located within the easements as described below and within the attached exhibits; and
 
WHEREAS, a value of $500.00 for the encroachment easement was established for these encroachment easements to be deposited into fund 7748, Project P537650; and 
 
WHEREAS,  it has become necessary in the usual daily operation of the Department of Public Service to authorize the Director to execute those documents necessary for the City to grant encroachment easements to OhioHealth Corporation; NOW, THEREFORE,
 
BE IT ORDAINED BY THE COUNCIL OF THE CITY OF COLUMBUS:
 
Section 1.  That the Director of the Department of Public Service be and is hereby authorized to execute those documents necessary for the City to grant these encroachments and legally allow them to extend into the public rights-of-way to OhioHealth Corporation, and attached exhibits; to-wit:
 
3 Dimensional Encroachment Easement
SIGN AND SIGN FOUNDATION ENCROACHMENT EASEMENT
BETWEEN 753.89’ TO 769.39’ ELEVATION (NAVD 88)
16.000 SQUARE FEET
 
Situated in the State of Ohio, County of Franklin, City of Columbus, in Half Section 25, Township 5, Range 22, Refugee Lands, being on, over and across the right-of-way of Town Street (82.5 feet wide), as dedicated in Deed Book F, Page 332 (destroyed by fire), replatted in Plat Book 3, Page 247, and also represented in Plat Book 14, Page 27, to extend between an elevation of 753.89 feet to 769.39 feet (NAVD 88), being 5 feet below curb to 10.5 feet above curb (all references are to the record of the Recorder’s Office, Franklin County, Ohio) and more particularly bounded and described as follows:
Beginning, for reference, at the intersection of the northerly right-of-way line of said Town Street and the westerly right-of-way line of Sixth Street;
Thence North 81° 49' 08" East, crossing said Sixth Street, a distance of 31.38 feet to a point;
Thence crossing said Town Street the following courses and distances:
South 08° 21' 52" East, a distance of 21.77 feet to the TRUE POINT OF BEGINNING for this description; North 81° 38' 08" East, a distance of 4.00 feet to a point
South 08° 21' 52" East, a distance of 4.00 feet to a point;
South 81° 38' 08" West, a distance of 4.00 feet to a point; and
North 08° 21' 52" West, a distance of 4.00 feet to the TRUE POINT OF BEGINNING, containing 16.000 square feet of land, more or less.
The Vertical Datum is based on the elevations established by the Franklin County Engineering Department at monument MORLAN, being 793.256 feet in elevation and at monument TACKETT, being 793.735 feet in elevation. The said elevations were transferred from said Franklin County Engineering Department monuments using static GPS procedures and the GEOID12B model to the site. The said monuments being source bench marks with elevations that are based on the North American Vertical Datum of 1988.
EVANS, MECHWART, HAMBLETON & TILTON, INC.
 
3 Dimensional Encroachment Easement
                                          SIGN AND SIGN FOUNDATION ENCROACHMENT EASEMENT
BETWEEN 754.94’ TO 767.94’ ELEVATION (NAVD 88)
16.533 SQUARE FEET
 
Situated in the State of Ohio, County of Franklin, City of Columbus, in Half Section 25, Township 5, Range 22, Refugee Lands, being on, over and across the right-of-way of Town Street (82.5 feet wide), as dedicated in Deed Book F, Page 332 (destroyed by fire), replatted in Plat Book 3, Page 247, and also represented in Plat Book 14, Page 27, to extend between an elevation of 754.94 feet to 767.94 feet (NAVD 88), being 5 feet below curb to 8 feet above curb (all references are to the record of the Recorder’s Office, Franklin County, Ohio) and more particularly bounded and described as follows: Beginning, for reference, at the intersection of the northerly right-of-way line of said Town Street and the easterly right-of-way line of Sixth Street;
Thence North 81° 49' 08" East, with said northerly right-of-way line, a distance of 48.36 feet to the TRUE POINT OF BEGINNING for this description;
Thence North 81° 49’ 08” East, with said northerly right-of-way line, a distance of 2.95 feet to a point; Thence crossing said Town Street the following courses and distances:
South 08° 41' 23" East, a distance of 5.53 feet to a point;
South 80° 48' 29" West, a distance of 3.00 feet to a point; and
North 08° 10' 52" West, a distance of 5.58 feet to the TRUE POINT OF BEGINNING, containing 16.533 square feet of land, more or less.
The Vertical Datum is based on the elevations established by the Franklin County Engineering Department at monument MORLAN, being 793.256 feet in elevation and at monument TACKETT, being 793.735 feet in elevation. The said elevations were transferred from said Franklin County Engineering Department monuments using static GPS procedures and the GEOID12B model to the site. The said monuments being source bench marks with elevations that are based on the North American Vertical Datum of 1988.
EVANS, MECHWART, HAMBLETON & TILTON, INC.
 
3 Dimensional Encroachment Easement
SIGN AND SIGN FOUNDATION ENCROACHMENT EASEMENT
BETWEEN 753.40’ TO 767.40’ ELEVATION (NAVD 88)
21.000 SQUARE FEET
 
Situated in the State of Ohio, County of Franklin, City of Columbus, in Half Section 25, Township 5, Range 22, Refugee Lands, being on, over and across the right-of-way of Town Street (82.5 feet wide), as dedicated in Deed Book F, Page 332 (destroyed by fire), replatted in Plat Book 3, Page 247, and also represented in Plat Book 14, Page 27, to extend between an elevation of 753.40 feet to 767.40 feet (NAVD 88), being 5 feet below curb to 9 feet above curb (all references are to the record of the Recorder’s Office, Franklin County, Ohio) and more particularly bounded and described as follows:

Thence South 81° 49' 08" West, with said northerly right-of-way line, a distance of 153.28 feet to a point; Thence crossing said Town Street the following courses and distances:

South 81° 49' 08" West, a distance of 3.00 feet to a point;
North 08° 10' 52" West, a distance of 7.00 feet to a point; and
North 81° 49' 08" East, a distance of 3.00 feet to the TRUE POINT OF BEGINNING, containing 21.000 square feet of land, more or less.
The Vertical Datum is based on the elevations established by the Franklin County Engineering Department at monument MORLAN, being 793.256 feet in elevation and at monument TACKETT, being 793.735 feet in elevation. The said elevations were transferred from said Franklin County Engineering Department monuments using static GPS procedures and the GEOID12B model to the site. The said monuments being source bench marks with elevations that are based on the North American Vertical Datum of 1988.
EVANS, MECHWART, HAMBLETON & TILTON, INC.
 
3 Dimensional Encroachment Easement
SIGN AND SIGN FOUNDATION ENCROACHMENT EASEMENT
BETWEEN 757.90’ TO 771.90’ ELEVATION (NAVD 88)
21.000 SQUARE FEET
 
Situated in the State of Ohio, County of Franklin, City of Columbus, in Half Section 25, Township 5, Range 22, Refugee Lands, being on, over and across the right-of-way of State Street, as dedicated in Deed Book 19, Page 464, to extend between an elevation of 757.90 feet to 771.90 feet (NAVD 88), being 5 feet below curb to 9 feet above curb (all references are to the record of the Recorder’s Office, Franklin County, Ohio) and more particularly bounded and described as follows: Beginning, for reference, at the intersection of the northerly right-of-way line of said State Street and the easterly right-of-way line of Chase Alley;
Thence crossing said State Street the following courses and distances:
South 07° 53' 43" East, a distance of 68.98 feet to a point;
North 81° 49' 08" East, a distance of 33.26 feet to the TRUE POINT OF BEGINNING for this description; North 81° 49' 08" East, a distance of 3.00 feet to a point;

The Vertical Datum is based on the elevations established by the Franklin County Engineering Department at monument MORLAN, being 793.256 feet in elevation and at monument TACKETT, being 793.735 feet in elevation. The said elevations were transferred from said Franklin County Engineering Department monuments using static GPS procedures and the GEOID12B model to the site. The said monuments being source bench marks with elevations that are based on the North American Vertical Datum of 1988.
EVANS, MECHWART, HAMBLETON & TILTON, INC.
 
3 Dimensional Encroachment Easement
WALL AND WALL FOUNDATION ENCROACHMENT EASEMENT
BETWEEN 752.65’ TO 762.55’ ELEVATION (NAVD 88)
0.012 ACRE
 
Situated in the State of Ohio, County of Franklin, City of Columbus, in Half Section 25, Township 5, Range 22, Refugee Lands, being on, over and across the right-of-way of Town Street, as dedicated in Deed Book “F”, Page 332 (destroyed by fire), replatted in Plat Book 3, Page 247, and also represented in Plat Book 14, Page 27, to extend between an elevation of 752.65 feet to 762.55 feet (NAVD 88), being 3.5 feet below curb to 6.4 feet above curb (all references are to the record of the Recorder’s Office, Franklin County, Ohio) and more particularly bound and described as follows:
Beginning, for reference, at the intersection of the northerly right-of-way line of said Town Street and the westerly right-of-way line of Sixth Street;
Thence North 81° 49' 08" East, crossing said Sixth Street, a distance of 30.80 feet to a point;
Thence crossing said Town Street the following courses and distances:
South 08° 10' 13" East, a distance of 11.49 feet to the TRUE POINT OF BEGINNING for this description;
South 08° 10' 13" East, a distance of 4.00 feet to a point;
South 81° 51' 46" West, a distance of 130.48 feet to a point;
North 08° 12' 39" West, a distance of 4.00 feet to a point; and 
North 81° 51' 46" East, a distance of 130.49 feet to the TRUE POINT OF BEGINNING, containing 0.012 acre of land, more or less.
The Vertical Datum is based on the elevations established by the Franklin County Engineering Department at monument MORLAN, being 793.256 feet in elevation and at monument TACKETT, being 793.735 feet in elevation. The said elevations were transferred from said Franklin County Engineering Department monuments using static GPS procedures and the GEOID12B model to the site. The said monuments being source bench marks with elevations that are based on the North American Vertical Datum of 1988.
EVANS, MECHWART, HAMBLETON & TILTON, INC.
 
 
SECTION 2. That the City Attorney is required to approve all instrument(s) associated with this ordinance prior to the Director of the Department of Public Service executing and acknowledging any of those instrument(s).  
 
SECTION 3.  That the City will receive a total of $500.00 for granting the encroachment easements, to be deposited into fund 7748, project P537650.
 
SECTION 4.  That this ordinance shall take effect and be in force from and after the earliest period allowed by law.
